candidates.explanation: Matches relative or absolute Unix filepaths with directories and filenames using common characters (letters, digits, underscore, dot, dash). Does not allow spaces or special characters.
Allows any non-slash characters in path segments, supporting relative (./, ../) and absolute (/), and filenames with spaces or special characters except '/'.
Matches absolute or relative paths, allowing empty filenames or directories, and any character except '/'. Handles trailing slashes and empty segments.
Strictly matches absolute Unix filepaths starting with '/', with segments of word characters, dots, or dashes. No support for spaces or special characters.
